attributes.action: Decrease the power within the House of Lords by a substantial amount.
attributes.additional_details:
How much lords can claim for an allowance: http://www.parliament.uk/about/mps-and-lords/about-lords/lords-allowances/

The amount of sitting lords: http://www.parliament.uk/business/lords/whos-in-the-house-of-lords/

Lords can block a bill for a year: http://www.parliament.uk/about/how/laws/parliamentacts/
attributes.background: There are currently around 800 sitting lords and as part of the legislative process that occurs through Parliament they have a significant amount of power such a the power to veto a bill for two years under Parliament Acts 1911 and 1949. The amount Lords can claim in allowances such be changed too.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking for a specific change to the Parliament Acts. 

We can't accept petitions about the allowances system in the House of Lords, because that's the responsibility of the House or Lords. We can only accept petitions about matters that are the responsibility of the Government or the House of Commons.
